newsitem.title: AUSTRALIA: St George to outsource cheque clearing.
newsitem.headline: St George to outsource cheque clearing.

text.p: St George Bank Ltd said on Wednesday it would outsource its cheque clearing operations to Austrapay Ltd, which carries out the same function for Advance Bank.
St George, which acquired Advance for A$2.6 billion in January, said the move would achieve further svings as part of the A$175 million cost reduction from merging the two banks.
Austrapay would take on cheque clearing operations for St George in all states except South Australia, where BankSA would continue to carry out cheque clearing.
Operations in Sydney, Melbourne, Brisbane and Perth would be transferred on November 24.

"By outsourcing this function to the same company Advance Bank currently uses, St George will streamline its cheque clearing process and at the same time achieve a substantial reduction in associated costs," managing director Jim Sweeney said in a statement.
Sweeney said in February that St George had decided to outsource its cheque processing operations.
